revised_title: The Function and Structure Changes of the Round Ligament in Utero-Gestation
tldr: The author examines the structure and function of the round ligament in the uterus, concluding that it is composed mainly of striped muscle fibers and suggesting that its primary function is related to the process of copulation. The study also discusses the changes in the uterus's structure during pregnancy, including the growth and development of muscle fibers, which are essential for the expulsion of the fetus.
